commits.author: chryswoods@gmail.com
commits.message:
I've updated the wrapped version of Python 3.3.3 to (again!) fix crashes
caused by my upgrade to Mavericks... Upgrade was free, but the pain

Code looks like it is working well, but care must be taken
as the beta version of Qt 5.2 is in use

rpath on OS X

Code appears to be working. Treat with caution as it links against
a beta version of Qt 5.2

Starting to construct "inquire" (the graphical viewer for free energy plots
and for inspecting simulation output). I've added an option to the cmake files
to disable graphical libraries and have renamed qtbase... to qt5 as I will need
to compile QtGui etc. if graphical libraries / applications are required.

commits.author: chryswoods@gmail.com
commits.message:
Fixed a bug in WSRC.py where the component free energies were using a swap water
group that was not added to the system, and was thus not updated throughout
the simulation. This is why the component free energies were so wrong!

commits.author: chryswoods@gmail.com
commits.message: Adding in the unit tests for the SireSystem FreeEnergyMonitor

commits.author: chryswoods@gmail.com
commits.message:
Fixed some bugs in the hard CLJ FreeEnergyMonitor. These were revealed via unit
testing in the unit test to be committed in the next commit

commits.author: chryswoods@gmail.com
commits.message: Updated the merge commands in trunk

commits.author: chryswoods@gmail.com
commits.message:
Merged the changes and bugfixes in "trunk" back into devel. This is a good reminder
why I MUST NOT CHANGE TRUNK DIRECTLY!!!

commits.author: chryswoods@gmail.com
commits.message:
Merged the changes and bugfixes in "trunk" back into devel. This is a good reminder
why I MUST NOT CHANGE TRUNK DIRECTLY!!!

commits.author: chryswoods@gmail.com
commits.message:
I've updated the WSRC script to separate out the intermolecular free energy components
(which do change with lambda) from the intramolecular components (which don't). This should
make the "bound" and "free" reported free energy components more meaningful as, at the moment,
they are dominated by the intramolecular energy of removing the ligand from the bound leg and
adding it to the free leg, and by the intermolecular energy within the swap water cluster
as it moves the other way (about 100+ kcal mol-1 for each, which cancel out in the total
free energy PMF)

commits.author: chryswoods@gmail.com
commits.message:
Fixed a bug in structureeditor where the last_uid was not initialised correctly when the 
editor was constructed from a MoleculeData.

Also fixed a bug in WindowedComponent where in some situations the windowed component
was not being updated correctly when the system constraints were applied

commits.author: chryswoods@gmail.com
commits.message:
Fixing a bug in StructureEditor where last_uid is not properly initialised in the MoleculeData
constructor (spotted by Hannes)

commits.author: chryswoods@gmail.com
commits.message:
Fixed a bug in the free energy monitor that meant that the component free energies
were accumulated incorrectly (they used the wrong alpha value and use 1 - lambda + delta_lambda
when it should be 1 - lambda - delta_lambda).

I've updated RepExMove so that I can disable RETI moves. This is useful for waterswap
as the RETI moves are only accepted infrequently, and may be messing up convergence...

I've added the ability to merge the molecules stored in the FreeEnergyMonitor and

commits.author: chryswoods@gmail.com
commits.message:
I've modified Histogram so that setting a bin width of zero disables collection of a histogram.
I've also updated FreeEnergyMonitor so that it stops collecting histograms for components
(they were massive memory hogs!)

Fixed the efficiency problems of PartialMolecule::extract() - I've worked around
them by only updating the AtomPairs value if it is not default. I've tested this is
ok in the unit test accompanying the next python commit

I'm in the process of debugging the very slow "extract" function in AtomicPairs.
This was not slow using Qt4, but is excrutiatingly slow in Qt5!

commits.author: chryswoods@gmail.com

I've moved the "scripts" directory to a subdirectory of "python" to speed up

I have also added my first stab at the waterswap script. I've decided to
use python argparse module to parse command line arguments and have
made sire's python ignore ipython when auto-running a script
(as ipython's argument parser got in the way of the script's argument parser)

commits.message:
